fields.value: Massachusetts Archives Collection. v.234-Revolution Resolves, 1781. SC1/series 45X, Petition of Jesse Putnam

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Petition subject: Support for individuals

Original: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:FHCL:13906078

Date of creation: 17810000

Petition location: Cambridge

Selected signatures:

  1. Jesse Putnam

Actions taken on dates: 1781-09-25,1781-10-16,1781-10-18,1781-10-18

Legislative action: Received in the House on September 25, 1781 and resolved and sent for concurrence and received in the Senate on October 16, 1781 and read and concurred with new draft and sent for concurrence and received in the House on October 18, 1781 and read and concurred and received in the House on October 18, 1781 and resolved

Total signatures: 1

Legislative action summary: Received, resolved, sent, received, read, concurred, new draft, sent, received, read, concurred, received, resolved

Legal voter signatures (males not identified as non-legal): 1

Female only signatures: No

Identifications of signatories: agent to the late estate of Thomas Oliver Esq. an absentee

Prayer format was printed vs. manuscript: Manuscript

Additional archivist notes: negro male child, bind out, binding out

Location of the petition at the Massachusetts Archives of the Commonwealth: Massachusetts Archives volume 234, pages 248-249
